questions.question_text:
Engineers in an organization plan to attend an international product show.
The engineers must be able to capture information about presented products based on personal assessment and interest. The engineers must capture the information by taking pictures of the booth, brochures, and other product-specific materials.
You need to provide a button flow to streamline the process.
Which two AI Builder models should you use? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
correct

Selected Answer: BE
Am I the only one who thinks that sentiment analysis is needed for"The engineers must be able to capture information about presented products based on personal assessment and interest."
why not E? if The engineers must be able to capture information about presented products based on personal assessment and interest.???

I vote for D. Business card reader and 
E. Form processing Most Voted
Language detection is typically used to identify the language in which a given text is written

Selected Answer: AD
For obvious reasons

So.....
A) Language - I think its a stretch to say you need the language model but considering these are our only options and we need two, I can understand it being correct because it is an International Convention.
D) Business Card Reader - by process of elimination, they are at a convention and likely meeting lots of people, the Business Card Reader would allow them to do that faster.

THE REASON IT CANT BE E is because Form Processing REQUIRES the form to be uniform and booths, brochures, etc. are anything but uniform. Form processing is for extracting info from receipts/tax docs. Because of this, I think its more reasonable to say they would use Business Card Reader.

Selected Answer: AE
A to detect language since this is international show. E for processing brochures and booth pictures. Business card readers are just for reading business cards
What about DE? language recognition does not make sense but form processing is better for retrieve information from a written text
A & D look correct

the case scenario it's a non sense why do I care to ue the language recognition? don't you see that the brochure is in English, Italian or whatever? and brochures are not business card so what's the point? and they are not a standard form too, so what's the right answer?

I think A E ?
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ai-builder/form-processing-model-requirements

comments.content: Finally AD, as there is probably no standard document on the show

questions.question_text:
A company uses Microsoft PowerPoint and Power BI to deliver presentations for company meetings. You have a Power BI visualization on a dashboard. The visualization displays sales summaries by product category.
You need to display the visualization on a PowerPoint slide. The slide must also include the last time that the visualization was refreshed, and a link back to the original visualization.
What should you do?

comments.content: as it shows last date time and link
C is incorrect. it doesn't display time last refreshed. D is the Right answer

discussion.content:
C. Select Export then PowerPoint from the Power BI dashboard.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/collaborate-share/end-user-powerpoint

Selected Answer: D
D seems right to me https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-copy-paste#copy-a-visual-as-an-image-to-your-clipboard

For me, I selected the visual, then I exported->PowerPoint ->choosing the 'Embed and Image' option. This gave me the auto-generated report in PowerPoint with the link and the information that was last refreshed. I don't know which one to choose, C, or D?
It is indeed D, just tried it. x
D is correct. Not C, because you can't export a dashboard.

Selected Answer: C
Even toguht I feel like C and D might both work I think MS is looking for answer C here because when you export to Powerpoint "The report is static; the slides retain the state of the report at the time of export."

Selected Answer: D
just tried it, D it is

choices.A: Select the Power BI visual and then select Export data.
choices.D: Select the Power BI visual and then select Copy visual as image.
choices.B: Expand the visual to full screen and use the print screen hot key.
choices.C: Select Export then PowerPoint from the Power BI dashboard.

questions.answer_description:
Instead: Proposed solution:
ג€¢ Create an Object Detection custom model in AI Builder.
ג€¢ Train the model with pictures of bicycles and then publish the trained model.
ג€¢ Add the Object Detector control to your canvas app.
Note: To train an object detection model to recognize your objects, you have to gather images that contain those objects.
The first thing you'll do when you create an AI Builder object detection model is to define its domain.

Upload images -
Then Train and publish your object detection model
The object detector component takes a photo or loads an image file to do an object detection scan. On a mobile device, the user chooses between taking a photo or selecting one already available in the device user interface. When an image is selected, the component automatically scans it to identify objects.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ai-builder/prediction-overview https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ai-builder/object-detector-component-in-powerapps
questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are creating a canvas app.
You need to automatically detect bicycles in pictures taken with the camera.
Proposed solution:
✑ Create an Object Detection custom model in AI Builder.
✑ Add the Object Detector control to your canvas app.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content: Similar with one previous question "Exam PL-100 topic 4 question 7 discussion" but this one does not include the step "Train the model with pictures of bicycles and then publish the trained model." for that matter, B is correct answer. Object detection model should be trained and published before adding control to the canvas app

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer!
thats is correct 100%

comments.content: Yes. B is the right answer. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/ai-builder/prebuilt-overview has the list of pre-built AI models and object detection is not in that list. Cross checked in make.powerautomate.com -> AI builder -> Explore -> All as well.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I think B as there is no pre-build Object Detection model
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/ai-builder/object-detection-overview

Selected Answer: A
It is a pre-built model, so I vote for A (custom model needs to be trained)

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.

After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.

You are creating a canvas app.

You need to automatically detect bicycles in pictures taken with the camera.

Proposed solution:

• Create an Object Detection pre-built model in AI Builder.
• Add the Object Detector control to your canvas app.

Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
correct
A is correct
That's correct. Power BI Reports are highly interactive and is suitable for handling large datasets and queries that take more than five minutes to complete.

questions.question_text:
You are designing an interactive report for a model-driven app. The report will use more than five million records. The query that retrieves data for the report requires more than five minutes to complete.

You need to create the report.

Which option should you use?
